title: Calories in a Spanakopita
meta_description: Discover calories in a spanakopita, including full nutrition breakdown per serving, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard triangular spanakopita (~100 g), baked with spinach, feta cheese, onions, dill, and phyllo dough; no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, portion size, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One spanakopita serving provides ~250 kcal, with good protein from feta and fiber from spinach.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add extra olive oil in phyllo layers

faqs.q: How many calories in a spanakopita?
faqs.a: About 250 kcal for one standard triangular serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a spanakopita?
faqs.a: Roughly 8 g, mainly from feta cheese and spinach.
Yes, ~25 g carbs per serving from phyllo dough.

faqs.q: How does baking affect spanakopita calories?
faqs.a: Baked versions are lower in fat than fried; oil in phyllo adds calories.

faqs.q: Can I make spanakopita lower calorie?
faqs.a: Use less cheese, low-fat options, or more veggies to reduce by 20-50 kcal.
